channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Can Australia Pull Off Barring Children From Social Media?
item.description: A law that restricts social media use to people 16 and over goes into effect in December, but much about it remains unclear or undecided.

item.title: Albert Ojwang Was Killed in Police Custody. Kenyans Are Not About to Let It Go.
item.description: At the funeral for Albert Ojwang, protesters in Kenya said his death was a call to action for the country’s youth.

item.title: Texas Flood Victims: What We Know
item.description: Child and adult campers and a camp director were among at least 51 people who have died in the flooding in Central Texas.

item.title: Ozzy Osbourne Plays His ‘Final Song’ With Black Sabbath
item.description: The metal luminary, 76, took the stage with his original bandmates at a farewell festival in his Birmingham, England, hometown on Saturday night.

item.title: Texas floods leave at least 51 dead, 27 girls missing as rescuers search devastated landscape
item.description: The destructive fast-moving waters along the Guadalupe River rose 26 feet in just 45 minutes before dawn Friday, washing away homes and vehicles.

item.title: Why the Dalai Lama’s Succession Is Complicated
item.description: Just before the Dalai Lama turned 90, he announced that his successor would be selected through the traditional process of reincarnation. Mujib Mashal...

item.title: Can Australia Pull Off Barring Children From Social Media?
item.description: A law that restricts social media use to people 16 and over goes into effect in December, but much about it remains unclear or undecided.

item.title: How to Make Better Decisions, According to a Neuroscientist
item.description: Making decisions that align long-term goals and short-term rewards is challenging, but it can lead to better choices and richer lives.

item.title: Albert Ojwang Was Killed in Police Custody. Kenyans Are Not About to Let It Go.
item.description: At the funeral for Albert Ojwang, protesters in Kenya said his death was a call to action for the country’s youth.

item.title: The Little Mountain Democracy That Sustains Tibet’s Refugee Nation
item.description: The exile government that was built by the Dalai Lama to preserve Tibetans’ cultural identity will be put to the test by his eventual succession.

item.title: The world could get carved up into these 3 blocs as Trump tariffs fuel deglobalization. Here’s which side each country might join
item.description: Wells Fargo sketched out a hypothetical scenario where the world is divided into three trading blocs led by the U.S., China, and the EU.

item.title: Musk forms America Party ‘to give you back your freedom’ after reigniting bitter feud with Trump
item.description: "When it comes to bankrupting our country with waste & graft, we live in a one-party system, not a democracy," Musk said on X.

item.title: Secret Service in US expands a global push against crypto scams
item.description: The Secret Service's Global Investigative Operations Center has seized nearly $400 million in digital assets over the last decade.

item.title: Texas summer camp hit by flood has been in the same clan for generations and has served the state’s top families
item.description: Relatives of prominent Texas politicians, including President Lyndon Johnson, have attended the camp over the years.

item.title: Khamenei Appears in Public for First Time Since Israel War Began
item.description: The long absence of Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, from public life had fueled speculation about his health and threats to his life.
